other_tests.findings: Pathological examination showed perivascular and perifollicular inflammation with telangiectasias, consistent with rosacea-like dermatitis.
Reportedly revealed a focal lymphohistiocytic infiltrate around a small muscular artery in the subcutis, with no evidence of vasculitis or erythema nodosum.

other_tests.procedure_name: Skin biopsy from left lateral malleolus
other_tests.findings: Showed thickening and hyalinization of small vessels in the dermis, with foci suggestive of microthrombi and a perivascular lymphocytic infiltrate; diagnostic of livedoid vasculopathy.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The livedoid appearance of the legs has resolved after treatment.

other_tests.findings: Showed extensive deposition of dermal mucin and lymphocytic infiltrate around middle and deep dermal vessels.
Showed deposition of mucin in the dermis, interface dermatitis at the dermoepidermal junction, and periadnexal and perineural lymphocytic inflammation.
